title: Big Mouth bosses apologise for ‘missing the mark’ over pansexuality explanation
text:
Big Mouth season 3 contained a scene that creators say ‘missed the mark’ (Picture: Netflix)

Big Mouth co-creator Andrew Goldberg has apologised on behalf of the show for ‘missing the mark’ in its explanation of pansexuality.

The Netflix cartoon, which takes a blunt look at young teens as they wrestle with their hormones, introduced a new character Ali (Ali Wong) in season three who proudly declared that she was pansexual.

When asked what that means, she rolled her eyes and said: ‘Bisexuality is so binary.’

‘Being pansexual means my sexual preference isn’t limited by gender identity,’ she added. ‘Some of you borings like tacos and some of you like burritos, and if you’re bisexual you like tacos and burritos.’

‘I’m saying I like tacos and burritos, and I could be into a taco that was born a burrito, or a burrito that’s transitioning into a taco, comprende? And honey, anything else on the f***ing menu.’

However, it’s come under fire for the scene not being representative of how people are able to come out, the lack of understanding during the attempt at representation, and the mislabelling and definition of pansexuality and bisexuality.

Guys, @aliwong is now on @bigmouth. It makes SO much sense. pic.twitter.com/5S76ezwIuD — Netflix Is A Joke (@NetflixIsAJoke) October 5, 2019

Goldberg, who co-wrote the show alongside Nick Kroll, posted a statement online apologising for the mistake and wrote: ‘We missed the mark here with this definition of bisexuality vs. pansexuality, and my fellow creators and I sincerely apologize for making people feel misrepresented.

‘Any time we try to delve into something as complex as human sexuality, it’s super challenging and this time we could have done better.’

‘Thank you to the trans, pan, and bi communities for further opening our eyes to these important and complicated issues of representation,’ they continued.

‘We are listening and we look forward to delving into all of this in future seasons.’

Big Mouth season 3 is available now on Netflix.
